sentence.Network_en: She looked at her husband crossly.
sentence.Network_cn: 她生气地看着自己的丈夫.

entry.def: If you cross something such as a room, a road, or an area of land or water, you move or travel to the other side of it. If you cross to a place, you move or travel over a room, road, or area of land or water in order to reach that place.

example.ex: She was partly to blame for failing to look as she crossed the road...
example.tran: 她过马路时没注意看，负有部分责任。

example.ex: Nine Albanians have crossed the border into Greece and asked for political asylum...
example.tran: 9名阿尔巴尼亚人穿过边境进入希腊境内并寻求政治避难。

entry.def: A road, railway, or bridge that crosses an area of land or water passes over it.

example.ex: The Defford to Eckington road crosses the river half a mile outside Eckington.
example.tran: 从迪福德到埃金顿的路穿过那条距埃金顿半英里的河。

entry.def: Lines or roads that cross meet and go across each other.

example.ex: ...the intersection where Main and Center streets cross...
example.tran: 主街和中心街的交叉路口

example.ex: It is near where the pilgrimage route crosses the road to Quimper.
example.tran: 那儿离朝圣之路与通往坎佩尔的道路的交叉路口很近。

entry.def: If someone or something crosses a limit or boundary, for example the limit of acceptable behaviour, they go beyond it.

example.ex: I normally never write into magazines but Mr Stubbs has finally crossed the line...
example.tran: 我向来不给杂志写信，但是斯塔布斯先生最后做得太过火了。

example.ex: No party is entitled to a seat in the new parliament unless it gets at least 5 per cent of the vote. Many will fail to cross that threshold.
example.tran: 任何政党只有获得至少5%的选票才能够在新一届议会中获得一个席位。很多政党都过不了这个门槛。

entry.def: If an expression crosses someone's face, it appears briefly on their face.

example.ex: Berg tilts his head and a mischievous look crosses his face...
example.tran: 伯格侧着头，脸上掠过一丝调皮的神情。

example.ex: A faint smile crossed his lips.
example.tran: 他嘴唇上掠过一丝微笑。

entry.tran: 十字形，十字架(基督教最重要的标记)
entry.def: A cross is a shape that consists of a vertical line or piece with a shorter horizontal line or piece across it. It is the most important Christian symbol.

example.ex: Round her neck was a cross on a silver chain...
example.tran: 她脖子上戴着一条银项链，上面挂着个十字架。

example.ex: He solemnly made the sign of the cross...
example.tran: 他庄重地画了个十字。

entry.def: If Christians cross themselves, they make the sign of a cross by moving their hand across the top half of their body.

example.ex: 'Holy Mother of God!' Marco crossed himself.
example.tran: “圣母啊！”马尔科画着十字说道。

entry.def: If you describe something as a cross that someone has to bear, you mean it is a problem or disadvantage which they have to deal with or bear.

example.ex: My wife is much cleverer than me; it is a cross I have to bear.
example.tran: 妻子比我聪明很多，这让我很难接受。

entry.tran: 叉字形记号;十字形记号
entry.def: A cross is a written mark in the shape of an X. You can use it, for example, to indicate that an answer to a question is wrong, to mark the position of something on a map, or to indicate your vote on a ballot paper.

example.ex: Put a tick next to those activities you like and a cross next to those you dislike.
example.tran: 在你喜欢的活动旁打钩，在不喜欢的活动旁画叉。

entry.tran: 在(支票)上画两条平行线(使支票只能划入银行账户，不能兑现)
entry.def: If a cheque is crossed, two parallel lines are drawn across it or printed on it to indicate that it must be paid into a bank account and cannot be cashed.

example.ex: Cheques/postal orders should be crossed and made payable to Newmarket Promotions.
example.tran: 应在支票/邮政汇票上画线，并使之可用于新市场促销活动的支付。

example.ex: ...a crossed cheque.
example.tran: 画线支票

entry.def: If you cross your arms, legs, or fingers, you put one of them on top of the other.

example.ex: Jill crossed her legs and rested her chin on one fist, as if lost in deep thought...
example.tran: 吉尔盘着腿，一个拳头支着下巴，仿佛陷入了沉思。

example.ex: Pop crossed his arms over his chest and watched us...
example.tran: 波普叉着胳膊看着我们。

entry.def: If you cross someone who is likely to get angry, you oppose them or refuse to do what they want.

example.ex: If you ever cross him, forget it, you're finished.
example.tran: 如果你曾经跟他作过对，就别想了，你没戏了。

entry.def: Something that is a cross between two things is neither one thing nor the other, but a mixture of both.

example.ex: 'Ha!' It was a cross between a laugh and a bark...
example.tran: “哈！”那声音听起来既像在笑又像在叫。

example.ex: It was a lovely dog. It was a cross between a collie and a golden retriever.
example.tran: 那条狗可爱极了，是柯利牧羊犬和金毛猎犬的杂交品种。

entry.tran: (足球、曲棍球等球队运动中的)横传
entry.def: In some team sports such as football and hockey, a cross is the passing of the ball from the side of the field to a player in the centre, usually in front of the goal.

example.ex: Le Tissier hit an accurate cross to Groves.
example.tran: 勒蒂西耶将球准确地横传给了格罗夫斯。

entry.def: A cross street is a road that crosses another more important road.

example.ex: The Army boys had personnel carriers blockading the cross streets.
example.tran: 陆军士兵用运兵车封锁了十字路口。

entry.def: Someone who is cross is rather angry or irritated.

example.ex: The women are cross and bored...
example.tran: 这个女人很生气，烦透了。

example.ex: I'm terribly cross with him...
example.tran: 我很生他的气。

auth_sentence.content: Finally, I rather crossly left for Dresden in a taxi.
auth_sentence.res_content: Finally, I rather crossly left for Dresden in a taxi.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finally, I rather crossly left for Dresden in a taxi.

auth_sentence.content: Russia was run by ardent free-marketeers but the attendant still told me crossly to take my hands out of my pockets.
auth_sentence.res_content: Russia was run by ardent free-marketeers but the attendant still told me crossly to take my hands out of my pockets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Russia was run by ardent free-marketeers but the attendant still told me crossly to take my hands out of my pockets.

auth_sentence.content: He desisted for a few minutes before he tried again, and again was crossly rejected.
auth_sentence.res_content: He desisted for a few minutes before he tried again, and again was crossly rejected.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He desisted for a few minutes before he tried again, and again was crossly rejected.

means.word_mean: 横地;相反地;故意为难地

sentences.en: She looked at her husband crossly.
sentences.cn: 她生气地看着自己的丈夫。
